result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Leggett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 3-15-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. Provide a DNA sample and pay  surcharge.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm and cannot vote vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Leggett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, pay the DNA surcharge, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction with 30 days credit; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 3-15-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Johnny Leggett in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Johnny Leggett in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Johnny Leggett not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is in custody in Waukesha County.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny Leggett in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Johnny Leggett in custody.  Ron Dague for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #97CF3186 and Sex Offender Registry documents dated 12/13/07 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Jennifer Bartelt-Department of Justice Sex Offender Registry Specialist.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Johnny Leggett in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Johnny Leggett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
